paragraphs.text: Just when the Ched Evans debate couldn't get any lower, up pops Gordon Taylor OBE.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: No matter how much anyone prayed that the Ched Evans "debate" had completed its race to the bottom this week, it was never going to have done so until we'd heard in full from Gordon Taylor
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That pleasure was always in the post
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: yesterday the PFA chief delivered, with what we might painfully cast as football's version of Godwin's law: a comparison with Hillsborough
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "He wouldn't be the first person to be found guilty, maintained his innocence, and been proved right," Taylor opined to the BBC
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "We know what happened with Hillsborough."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Oh, man
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Gordon Taylor
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Or rather, GORDON TAYLOR OBE, as his name appeared in my inbox
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he emailed me once
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Sensationally dim, wantonly self-interested, wildly over-remunerated and frequently morally compromised, Gordon functions as an auto-satire on all the worst things people think about football
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Reputed to be the highest paid union official in the world, and one who has been in his job for just the 33 years
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Taylor has now said he didn't mean"to upset anybody"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: though I need hardly add that he has no plans to consider his position after his latest display of incompetence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In which case, I hope he'll forgive my considering it for him - an act that has become as essential an annual event for me as putting up the Christmas tree or rewatching the early work of Steven Seagal
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Unless
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Taylor's presence is dramatically revealed as the second-highest-profile instance of affirmative action for idiots in public life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the first being Iain Duncan Smith's position in government
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: - then
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it hardly needs pointing out again that Gordon is no longer fit for purpose
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: indeed he ever was
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But more on his record shortly
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: That Taylor should have rifled through his Rolodex of metaphors and alighted on the absolute archetype of victim-blaming in order to continue obliquely victim-blaming in the Ched Evans case
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: well, perhaps there's a mirthless laugh to be had there
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But it would take a stronger stomach than mine to manage it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The sadness - or rather, one of many acute and diverse sadnesses - is that this was a week in which football was crying out for an intelligent and sensitive advocate, finding itself once more cast in a role it should never be required to occupy in a truly civilised society
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: All manner of people appeared convinced that the game should mitigate the deficiencies of the criminal justice system
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: just as a worrying number were keen to say Evans was absolutely welcome to work again - flipping burgers or sweeping the streets
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: These are the jobs that are fit for rapists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: we must infer
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: which must feel hugely complimentary to those non-rapists who are putting in shifts doing the same for minimal pay right now
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Meanwhile
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: as the Mail's Martin Samuel pointed out, footballers - footballers!-"are placed in the same bracket as doctors, teachers or legal professionals"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that seems to you like a view of society worth shoring up
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the week will have felt distinctly encouraging
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As for football fans - the great "them" of many debates - they have spent the week being cast as too thick and impressionable to be able to make their own judgments about a convicted rapist
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Evans could have been nothing but a role model, presumably to the vast tumult who turn out at Boundary Park each week
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: (4,415 on average last season)
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: It's as depressing as it is disturbing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Such toxicity and lunacy have attached themselves to football and its place in our society
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: that those who love the sport as well as those who play it really need the calm, cool intellect and charm of a Shami Chakrabarti to lobby in their real interests and those of the game
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Instead
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they have Gordon Taylor
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: whose focus was memorably dismissed by Peter Schmeichel during one stage of the Paul Gascoigne saga
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Instead of getting great deals on cars and other luxury goods for members," the former Manchester United and Denmark goalkeeper fumed,"PFA should commit more time and funds to help the like of Gazza."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Taylor was stung - into self-defence, of course
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Peter doesn't know what we've done for Paul," he announced to the Press Association,"a lot of which has to be confidential."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It certainly does
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Except Gordon just couldn't bring himself to keep it that way
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The next few days were spent with this union leader giving detailed interviews on Gascoigne's mental state and past treatment
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: in which he divulged telephone calls with the player, made off-the-cuff pseudo-clinical diagnoses, and - unbelievably - used the union's own website to warn
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we're not careful
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it is going to be akin to George Best."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Then again, Taylor had form with sharing details of members' treatment, having done the same with Joey Barton only a few months previously
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Anyway, on we go
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: In 2013 came the revelation that Taylor had amassed a? 100,000 debt to a bookmaker - almost an inevitability to those who recalled him pontificating about a "zero tolerance" approach to betting among players just a couple of years before
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And no round-up of Gordon's greatest hits would be complete without a look at that endlessly intriguing confidentiality deal he signed with News International
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which awarded him a? 700,000 settlement for phone-hacking in return for his silence
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: As the News of the World's lawyers later had it in a letter to the Commons culture, media and sport committee, Taylor's lawyers had informed them that he "wanted to be vindicated or made rich"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Given
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that he reportedly earns? 984,000 a year (maybe more these days)
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: you might judge him to be rich already
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: - but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: of course
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we know which option won out, a deal that precluded Taylor from breathing a word about phone-hacking to any of his union's members
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who he might reasonably have concluded could have been victims themselves
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As they were eventually proved(by others) to have been
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So there you have him: the pastoral carer who reveals details of his members' mental health in the noble cause of self-defence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The gambler who wishes to outlaw gamblers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The ur-phone-hacking plaintiff who agreed to take the? 700,000 and say absolutely nothing about the matter, despite being responsible for players
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who of course turned out to have been targeted too
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And now he is the victim-blamer's victim-blamer, in a week where, you might have hazarded, even Katie Hopkins couldn't have contrived to make a grim situation worse
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Still
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: experience would indicate that Taylor ignores his detractors at the very opposite of his peril
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So all that remains is for me to take the early opportunity to apologise for next year's inevitable appearance of this column, and bid Mr Taylor a cordial au revoir
paragraphs.label: assumption
